Package hw4

Class BaseElement

java.lang.Object
api.AbstractElement
hw4.SimpleElement
hw4.MovingElement
hw4.BaseElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
LiftElement, PlatformElement
public abstract class BaseElement extends MovingElement
A base element is an abstract base class to classes like PlatformElement or LiftElement, with two distinctive behaviors. First, it can be set to move either horizontally or vertically within a fixed set of boundaries. On reaching a boundary, the x or y velocity is reversed accordingly. Second, it maintains a list of associated elements whose basic motion all occurs relative to the BaseElement.
Author:
Nicholas Jacobs

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseElement

      public BaseElement(double x, double y, int width, int height)
      Constructs a new BaseElement through reference to a child class. Initially the left and right boundaries are Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY and Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, respectively.
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate of initial position of upper left corner
      y - y-coordinate of initial position of upper left corner
      width - object's width
      height - object's height

  • Method Details

    • switchVelocity

      protected void switchVelocity(double deltaX, double deltaY)
      Used as a helper method for switching this element's velocity. If deltaY != 0 then it is moving vertically and deltaY is reversed. If deltaX != 0 then it is moving horizontally and deltaX is reversed.
      Parameters:
      deltaX - This object's x velocity
      deltaY - This object's y velocity
      See Also:
      • MovingElement.setVelocity(double, double)

    • distanceTillBound

      protected double distanceTillBound()
      Helper method calculating the distance to the right or left bound if moving horizontally or the distance to upper or lower bound if moving vertically
      Returns:
      distance distance to right or left bound if moving horizontally distance to upper or lower bound if moving vertically

    • update

      public void update()
      Overrides MovingElement's implementation of update by calling super.update so the base element moves and then iterates through its associatedElementList and update's each element's position.
